TopicTitle: Need help with a decision on recording games!

Articles.Content:
Hello all!

So I have a YouTube channel where I've done a few KSP videos in the style of Danny2462, but I am looking to branch out now that I'm (slowly) settling into my school routine. I'm a bit stuck, and am not sure where to go, honestly!

My setup is fairly decent, but I have a horrible microphone, a bad situation to record with. However, until I come across more money, I'm stuck with it. So until then, I need help deciding which game I can play at first. I've narrowed it down to a few solutions:

Minecraft

KSP

Garry's Mod (with friends)

Slender (I will do with face recording, and I get really scared by horror games so it would be funny XD >.<)

Fallout 3

Sid Meier's Pirates!

If you need more info on any of the games, lemme know, but what do you think I should do?
You should add turbo dismount to the list. It would be great for youtubing. XP

Talking about recording, I might do some myself. Does anybody know any good free editing software? I will most likely do video in the way Danny does (no voice, but words appear on screen instead), so I need a good free editing software. I plan on using OBS for recording. I also might do some streams occasionally.
I vote Slender. Because I've never heard of it.

I vote Slender. Because I've never heard of it.

good for you...i mean it.

do ksp though.

Well I love survival horror but I can't vote for slender just because the game mechanic is so boring

even the newest one is still just to collect a few things without the slenderman getting you.

you might want to try Outlast instead, it's a thousand times better and scarier and the story is (somewhat) based in reality (CIA's MKUltra experiments)

I suppose KSP is going to be the hot favourite but keep in mind that there are loads of career playthroughs on youtube at the moment
i have to agree with mart. outlast is not really scary...its super terrifying.

Minecraft, Garry's Mod, and Slender are very popular, and pretty much everyone done vids on those games already. I think you could try Fallout with some crazy mods, that could be fun.

But to be honest you should record games tghat are most fun for ya
